cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles SSE of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Continues northwest over the central Gulf, then turns north-northwest to north, aiming for the southwest-central Louisiana coast within the High Island TX–Grand Isle LA watch area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from High Island TX to Grand Isle LA; Tropical Storm Watch from San Luis Pass TX to west of High Island TX and portions of SE Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: None affecting Texas coast (only Yucatán TS warning discontinued)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from High Island TX eastward to the Alabama–Florida border, greatest impacts expected southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely; only a 7 % cumulative chance of 34-kt winds over the next five days.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Little to no storm-surge inundation expected along the Corpus Christi area (surge guidance shows <3 ft west of Port O’Connor).
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring brief showers, but widespread heavy rainfall (>4 in) is not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Higher surf and rip-current risk along area beaches through the weekend.
